intro: Epilobium williamsii, commonly known as Williams' willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a fibrous root system. Epilobium williamsii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
